known_media_coverage.title: Corporate Landlords Nickel and Dime D.C. Tenants with Deceptive and Hidden Utility Fees
findings: Pervasive pattern of charging tenants hidden or misleading utility fees
Kettler properties included in investigation of 20 buildings
Jamison at Dakota Crossing: tenants received bills of nearly $1,500 for 9 months of water charges
Many tenants pay rent with government housing subsidies
Kettler would not provide rent history until water bill paid
Excessive bills motivated tenants to move out
Tenant LaShawn Melton: Lease specified water charges based on actual usage, but bills didn't match
Tenant had to seek Emergency Rental Assistance Program to settle balance
Concern for elderly and disabled tenants who lack means to advocate
Complaints filed with Office of the People's Counsel (OPC)
Another disabled tenant: $631 water bill from Studebaker
known_media_coverage.significance: Documents systematic fee practices affecting subsidized housing tenants

details.violation: Unlawfully refused to accept housing vouchers at Washington D.C. properties
details.applies_to: All multi-family rental properties in D.C. managed by Kettler
key_terms: Affirmative marketing that properties accept voucher holders
No minimum income or credit score requirements for voucher holders
Mandatory fair housing training for leasing agents and property management staff
Regular compliance testing conducted by ERC
$140,000 payment to ERC (damages, attorneys' fees, training costs)
Affirmation and distribution of non-discrimination policy
Designation of Housing Choice Voucher liaison within Kettler's compliance department
legal_basis: D.C. Consumer Protection Procedures Act violation
details.allegations: Kettler used unlawful minimum income and credit history requirements to reject applicants with housing vouchers
